required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Ziresovir in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Sequential Parallel Group, Single Ascending Dose Study Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Ziresovir in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, dose escalation study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics (PK) of ziresovir following a single ascending oral dose administration in healthy adult subjects under fasted conditions.

detailed_description.textblock:
Up to 3 dose cohorts are planned. The ziresovir dose level of each cohort is determined based on the collective clinical and nonclinical data of ziresovir.
The proposed dose levels of Cohorts 1, 2 and 3 are 300 mg and up to 600 mg and up to 900 mg, respectively.
A total of up to 24 subjects will be randomized with 18 subjects to receive active drug and 6 subjects to receive placebo in a double-blind fashion. Eight subjects will be randomized in each dose cohort, with 6 subjects to receive active drug and 2 subjects o receive placebo.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: numbers of all AEs
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 22 days
primary_outcome.description: The Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 5 will be used to grade AEs

primary_outcome.measure: percentages of all AEs
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 22 days
primary_outcome.description: The Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 5 will be used to grade AEs

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.description: blood pressure in millimeter of mercury

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in pulse rate
primary_outcome.description: pulse rate in times per minute

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in respiratory rate
primary_outcome.description: respiratory rate in times per minute

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in oral temperature
change from baseline in Prothrombin time/International Normalized Ratio
primary_outcome.description: INR is calculated from the PT and allows for worldwide standardization of results.

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in Thrombin time
change from baseline in activated Partial Thromboplastin time
primary_outcome.description: activated Partial Thromboplastin time in seconds

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in Hemoglobin (Hgb) count
change from baseline in Hematocrit (Hct)
change from baseline in Platelet count
change from baseline in Red blood cell (RBC) count
change from baseline in White blood cell (WBC) count with differential
change from baseline in Specific gravity from urinalysis
change from baseline in pH from urinalysis
change from baseline in Protein from urinalysis
change from baseline in Glucose from urinalysis
change from baseline in Ketones from urinalysis
change from baseline in Bilirubin from urinalysis
change from baseline in Blood from urinalysis
change from baseline in Nitrites from urinalysis
change from baseline in Leukocytes from urinalysis
change from baseline in Urobilinogen from urinalysis
Incidence of abnormal Microscopic urine analysis
change from baseline in heart rate-corrected QT interval from resting 12-lead ECGs
primary_outcome.description: ECGs will be performed after the subject has been supine for at least 5 minutes

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in heart rate from resting 12-lead ECGs
primary_outcome.description: ECGs will be performed after the subject has been supine for at least 5 minutes

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in QRS intervals from resting 12-lead ECGs
primary_outcome.description: ECGs will be performed after the subject has been supine for at least 5 minutes

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in treatment-emergent T-wave morphology from resting 12-lead ECGs
primary_outcome.description: ECGs will be performed after the subject has been supine for at least 5 minutes

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in appearance of U-waves from resting 12-lead ECGs
primary_outcome.description: ECGs will be performed after the subject has been supine for at least 5 minutes

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of abnormal physical findings
primary_outcome.description: full physical examination will be conducted at screening and an abbreviated physical exam will be conducted on Day -1 and Day 2. A symptom-directed physical exam will be conducted on Day 3 and Day 4.

secondary_outcome.measure: To characterize the drug concentration of ziresovir following single ascending doses by oral administration in healthy adult male and female subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (within 90 minutes prior to dosing) and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, 12, 24, 48, and 72 hours post-dose

arm_group.description: The study drugs will be administered to subjects by CRU staff at approximately 8:00 a.m. (± 1 hour), following an overnight fast. Immediately following administration of the assigned dose of the study drugs, subjects will be given water such that their water consumption is approximately 240 mL as follows: If administered 60 mL as the study drug dose, follow with approximately 180 mL water. If administered 120 mL as the study drug dose, follow with approximately 120 mL water. If administered 180 mL as the study drug dose, follow with approximately 60 mL water.

The study drugs will be administered to subjects by CRU staff at approximately 8:00 a.m. (± 1 hour), following an overnight fast. Immediately following administration of the assigned dose of the study drugs, subjects will be given water such that their water consumption is approximately 240 mL as follows: If administered 60 mL as the study drug dose, follow with approximately 180 mL water. If administered 120 mL as the study drug dose, follow with approximately 120 mL water. If administered 180 mL as the study drug dose, follow with approximately 60 mL water.

intervention.description: Planned treatments are: Cohort 1: 300 mg of ziresovir Cohort 2: up to 600 mg of ziresovir Cohort 3: up to 900 mg of ziresovir
Planned treatments are: Cohort 1: 300 mg of placebo Cohort 2: up to 600 mg of placebo Cohort 3: up to 900 mg of placebo
